description.value:
Glabro is a near-human war form, blending human shape with obvious supernatural strength.

A Garou in Glabro form appears as a massively built humanoid with bestial features. This form allows the Garou to exert physical dominance without fully embracing the terror of their true war form.

Glabro balances restraint and power, making it ideal for intimidation, short bursts of violence, or conflicts where subtlety has already failed.

While in Glabro (Near-Human) form, you gain the following benefits and limitations.

Speed: 30 feet

Benefits:

• You have advantage on Strength checks.

• You gain a +1 bonus to AC.

• Bite: 1d8 + Strength modifier (piercing).

• Claw: 1d6 + Strength modifier (slashing).

Limitations:

• You have disadvantage on Charisma checks made to blend in among humanoids.
